column4: is there a way to set ubuntu to run a peice of code like every 5 minuets
Yes, make a cronjob for it.
Crontab really is the easiest way.
Crontab is really easy once you figure it out.
Write your code so that it will run "unattended", say it's called "myscript.sh", you just run "crontab -e" and add a line that says "*/5 * * * * /home/username/myscript.sh"
can you help me set it up
Save and exit and that's it.
